data.prayer: Father, you desire to blot out the sins of the people of Xing‘an, Nei Mongol, China. You said, if they turn to you, you will dissolve their sins like mist.
data.verse: I have blotted out, as a thick cloud, your transgressions, and, as a cloud, your sins. Return to me, for I have redeemed you.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Xing‘an, Nei Mongol, China
data.section_summary: What beauty can God be thanked for in this photo?

data.prayer: Father, reveal your kingdom to those with a childlike heart in the county of Xing'an.
data.verse: At that time, Jesus answered, “I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you hid these things from the wise and understanding, and revealed them to infants. Yes, Father, for so it was well-pleasing in your sight.

data.prayer: Spirit, make the church in Xing‘an, Nei Mongol, China humble and willing to hear the sometimes hard voices of prophets bringing the light of truth on them.
data.verse: So have I become your enemy by telling you the truth?

data.prayer: Spirit, supernaturally prepare encounters with the gospel on sites like Facebook and Instagram for the 961,100 people living in Xing'an.
Lord, remember the Mongol, Khalka people. Make the Mongol, Khalka people a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for your own possession.
Father, see the suffering of your people in the county of Xing'an. Deliver all those who have not forgotten your Word.
data.verse: Look on my suffering and deliver me, for I have not forgotten your law.

data.prayer: Spirit, teach the 72,910 believers in Xing'an that when they seek first your Kingdom and your righteousness, you will abundantly provide all they need.
data.verse: And God is able to bless you abundantly, so that in all things at all times, having all that you need, you will abound in every good work.

data.prayer: Jesus, please give the apostles in Xing‘an, Nei Mongol, China a vision for the harvest, and a passion to see the gospel spread to every corner of the the county.
data.verse: So Christ himself gave the apostles, the prophets, the evangelists, the pastors and teachers, to equip his people for works of service, so that the body of Christ may be built up

location.name: Xing'an
location.people_groups_list: Olot, Buriat, Chinese, Hui, Muslim Chinese, Bogol, Mongolian, Peripheral
location.people_groups_list_w_pop: Olot (3,200), Buriat, Chinese (170,000), Hui, Muslim Chinese (13,870,000), Bogol (1,400), Mongolian, Peripheral (5,636,000)
